intro: Erodium somanum, commonly known as the common storm weed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, pinkish to purple flowers that bloom from spring to early summer. The plant has slender, branched stems and small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in cultivated fields. Botanically, it belongs to the family Leguminosae (Fabaceae) and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and legume-like pods.
